thread.title: NFL Week 4 fantasy studs and duds
thread.title_full: NFL Week 4 fantasy studs and duds

title: NFL Week 4 fantasy studs and duds
text:
The studs and the duds from Week 4 in fantasy football. 
STUDS 
358 passing yards, 3 passing TDs, -1 rushing yards, 26.2 points. 
Led his team to a last-second win over the Browns. 
Devonta Freeman, RB, ATL 
68 rushing yards, 81 receiving yards, 3 TDs, 32.9 points. 
He was pulled in the third quarter and still led all scorers this week. 
Jeremy Hill, RB, CIN 
40 rushing yards, 3 TDs, 1 2-point convert, 24 points. 
Giovani Bernard had more carries, but Hill got them when they counted. 
Tavon Austin, WR, STL 
96 receiving yards, 20 rushing yards, 2 TDs, 23.6 points. 
This sort of performance is what they had in mind when drafting him. 
Vincent Jackson, WR, TB 
147 receiving yards, 1 TD, 20.7 points. 
Had 15 targets this week compared to 10 in the past two weeks combined. 
Coby Fleener, TE, IND 
83 receiving yards, 1 TD, 14.3 points. 
Showed some good chemistry with backup QB Matt Hasselbeck. 
Atlanta Falcons DEF 
21 points allowed, 1 sack, 1 INT, 3 fumbles recovered, 2 TDs, 21 points. 
Cairo Santos, K, KC 
7 FGs, 27 points. 
Became the fifth person to hit seven FGs in a game, one short of the record. 
DUDS 
213 passing yards, 1 passing TD, 2 INTs, 10.3 points. 
His team may have won, but he didn’t help fantasy owners much. 
Ryan Mallett, QB, HOU 
150 passing yards, 1 INT, 5 points. 
Was benched in favour of Brian Hoyer. Ouch. 
Arian Foster, RB, HOU 
10 rushing yards, 25 receiving yards, 1 fumble lost, 1.5 points. 
It was exactly the season debut we were hoping for, as he averaged just 1.2 yards per carry. 
Carlos Hyde, RB, SF 
20 rushing yards, 2 receiving yards, 2.2 points. 
Hasn’t performed well since Week 1. 
Tre Mason, RB, STL 
-1 rushing yard, -0.1 points. 
This is clearly Todd Gurley’s team now. 
Julio Jones, WR, ATL 
38 receiving yards, 3.8 points. 
The Falcons got out to a huge lead without even needing Jones. 
Odell Beckham Jr., WR, NYG 
38 receiving yards, 3.8 points. 
Was targetted 12 times, but only managed five catches against Bills. 
DeVante Parker, WR, MIA 
He’s buried on the depth chart and didn’t even have a single target. 
Jordan Reed, TE, WAS 
37 receiving yards, 1 fumble lost, 1.7 points. 
Was knocked out of the game after suffering a concussion. 
I HOPE YOU STARTED 
Allen Hurn went out and did what most No. 2 receivers have done against the Colts this season: Light them up. With Vontae Davis keeping Allen Robinson in check, Hurns hauled in 11 passes for 116 yards and a TD. 
—I wonder if Kirk Cousins even started himself in his football pool this week? Well, if he is one of the 6% of Yahoo owners that does and started him, he would’ve been rewarded with 21.7 points, the second most among QBs this week. Sponsored Links
